headline: Companies Are Holding Back on M&A. Where the Next Deals Will Happen.
summary: Global deal value surged to $5.19 trillion in 2021 according to PwC, when the global economy recovered sharply from the pandemic.  The economic environment in 2025 would seem ideal for a rise in dealmaking.  President Donald Trump’s tariffs could weigh on economic growth in the U.S. and overseas, and could fuel U.S. inflationary pressures—which could mean the end of Fed rate cuts.
